intro: Pseudocyclanthera, commonly known as the false cyclanthera, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species that are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plants are characterized by their climbing habit, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. The fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature.
